The code defines a Python module for handling function calls in an OpenAI-based system. It imports various libraries and modules, including json, logging, and various types from the OpenAI and Pydantic libraries. It also imports some custom functions and utilities from the instructor module.

The code defines a class `OpenAISchema` that extends `BaseModel`

The module provides utilities for defining and handling function schemas compatible with OpenAI and Gemini APIs. It imports necessary libraries, sets up logging, and defines a generic type variable `T`. A `classproperty` decorator is used to generate a Gemini-compatible function schema from an OpenAI schema, mapping parameters and metadata accordingly. This enables seamless integration of function definitions across different AI platforms. The output is a Gemini `FunctionDeclaration` object containing the function name, description, and parameter schema.
